1430244227192016898.text: I worked hard to ensure a date was guaranteed that would not leave the crucial legislation on hold, and I am proud that I championed negotiations to help reach this milestone. I will continue to work with my colleagues in the budget process to deliver for Oregonians.

1430244225736581120.text: I am committed to seeing the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act enacted into law as soon as possible, and that is why I will be voting for the procedural rule today that sets a firm deadline of September 27 for final passage.

1430244224239243265.text: The legislation would do all this and more while creating two million jobs per year over the next decade, keeping America globally competitive for our children and grandchildren for generations to come.

1430244222788009986.text: The package also ensures American families are connected to affordable, high-speed broadband no matter where they live, while also providing for the energy resiliency we desperately need as climate change grips Oregon and the rest of the nation.

1430244221382893573.text: and the largest investments ever made in public transit, electric vehicles and our sewer and water systems.

1430244219508068361.text: This legislation would mark a landmark moment in American history by making the largest investment in our nation’s roads and bridges in nearly a century; the largest investments in rail since the invention of Amtrak;

1430244218027470851.text: After today’s procedural vote, we will have cleared the last major hurdle that paves the way for a floor vote that will send the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act as a standalone bill to the President.

1428858601225867270.text: I am urging a standalone vote on infrastructure, and I look forward to continued engagement in the conversation in the days ahead to prioritize smart investments for Oregonians and Americans.

1428858599976013825.text: If we put these vital priorities on hold now when there is a clear path to passage in sight, we risk failing to deliver on an issue that is vigorously supported by the President, vast majority of the Senate and most importantly—the American people. That would be unacceptable.

1428858598600318977.text: This would create good-paying union jobs, grow and support businesses, help combat climate change and keep our country globally competitive.

1428858597320978434.text: The landmark legislation would rebuild our roads, bridges, rail and water systems—and make transformative investments like ensuring universal access to affordable high-speed broadband and strengthening energy resiliency.

1428858595869827072.text: The Senate overwhelmingly voted to invest $1 trillion to modernize America’s aging infrastructure for the 21st century, and the House has a duty to pass the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act without delay.

The 0 percent interest rate is for the following types of federal student loans owned by ED:

-Defaulted and non-defaulted Direct Loans

-Defaulted and non-defaulted FFEL Program loans

-Federal Perkins Loans

-Non-federal owned FFEL or Perkins loans are not eligible

1247590104304168960.text: All suspended payments will still count if you are making efforts towards Public Service Loan Forgiveness or IDR forgiveness

1247589933356855299.text:

-Servicers will be issuing refunds for payments made between March 13th and April 10th when this will go into effect for most loan servicers

Payment suspensions and the 0 percent interest will be available for federally-owned loans

-Private loans and Non-federal FFEL and Perkins loans are not eligible under the CARES Act

1152375280092307456.text:
Our tour today is over. 

We are now meeting to share our initial impressions and ideas to help alleviate some of the hardships for migrants and how to empower the agencies on the ground in Texas to do a better job.

Our press conference will be streamed live on Facebook.

1152366259012587522.text: These images are being posted publicly and are available for media use.

1152364073465593857.text: This is a play pen for toddlers who came to the border unaccompanied. This is an unbelievable situation where horrific conditions are the first hope at a better life in America. https://t.co/bhjrCVFlfx

1152362128143257600.text: I do not always have the right thing to say. But, I am a father to 8 amazing kids and I think of them. These kids here in Texas are so tough. They came to America with hope of a better life. We have to move past the partisan rhetoric and do what is right for innocent children. https://t.co/xiSLNMDmkF

1152360080014229504.text: This is a beautiful baby that I just met. He was brought here by a man whose DNA did not match his. This is huge problem, men are kidnapping innocent children and using them to get across the border. This is bigger than political party. These are innocent kids and we have to help https://t.co/wDo2J7ukt9

1152357665043091456.text: Men without children are being held longer. There are no facilities to move them too. https://t.co/XNfQaXa5ei

1152324083721392130.text: Young men here are in bunkbeds. 4-6 to a room. I met a very kind young man from Guatemala whose parents saved up to send him to the United States. Life there is bad and there are few opportunities for young people.

1152318250597924865.text: Now touring HHS facilities where boys ages 13-17 stay. Average stay is 55 days. Longest stay in the facility was 600 days before reunification.

1152296656135708672.text: We are being told that there are two microwaves to feed all of the migrants coming through Port of Hidalgo. Some days there are as many as 2000 people seeking entry.

1152253359065391104.text: These images are posted publicly and available for media use.

1152250015764627456.text:
*sound on*

We are heading across the bridge to Mexico https://t.co/bfLOEFqtAP

1152245060525862912.text: Having frank and at times difficult conversations with the immigration officials here. I feel like they are being honest and straightforward about the situation here at Hidalgo-I have very grateful for their time and insight. https://t.co/mCs0BF7qkL

1152242840661086214.text:
Now at the Port of Hidalgo. 

This line of cars is lined up to come in via the Port. Many people are transported here by cartels for thousands of dollars. 

Folks are here for 24-48 hours and released to Catholic charities. https://t.co/ZuQuDOACMk

1152231813349347329.text:
It is snack time for the kids here at the processing facility. 

We are talking to them about what it is like here and how they are doing. 

This "pod" is for women and children. https://t.co/Wov2lmjPqr

1152226253413474305.text: Here in McAllen, Texas. Having our first meeting with Border Patrol officers. This facility processes families only for 24-48 hours. https://t.co/g2L49BDmq3

1151938906415345664.text: Our brave first responders do the unimaginable every single day. That's why I cosponsored the HERO Act which would help improve training for mental health staff and develop best practices on identifying, preventing and treating PTSD in first responders. https://t.co/WdBQwyxKyF

334830064522899457.text: Very pleased my amend to allow the organic industry to pursue a check off program if they want to just PASSED 29-17. #FARRM #farmbill

334828331268714496.text: A check-off program funds advertising campaigns, but also critical research that deals with plant pest and disease issues and best practices

334828115618582528.text: This does not create a check off. It’s an acknowledgment however of the growing importance of the organic industry in American agriculture.

334827871304568832.text: I want to emphasize this amend DOES NOT create a check off program – it allows the organic industry to pursue one should they want to.

334827718162149376.text: The amendment I’m offering today removes the statutory barriers that currently prevent the creation of an organic check-off program cont...

334827510057558016.text: It’s important to note this is not an amendment or an issue pitting organic vs conventional agriculture and should not be portrayed as such.
